name: Barbell Wrist Curl
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on a bench or ledge with your body facing away from the bar, and hold the barbell behind you with an underhand grip (palms facing upwards) with your hands shoulder-width apart apart.
2. Keep your core engaged, lift your heels off the ground onto a block or bench to stabilize your lower back, if necessary.
3. Hold the bar with your upper arms resting against your body and only moving your forearms during the exercise.
4. Slowly CURL your wrists UPWARDS towards your shoulders until you feel tension in your forearm muscles. Keep your upper arms still and do not lift the entire arm.
5. Return to the starting position in a slow, controlled manner.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Barbell wrist curls is an exercise that targets the forearm muscles
